text: Jean-Louis René Olry (born August 6, 1946 in Montrouge) is a French retired slalom canoeist who competed from the mid-1960s to the early 1970s. He won a bronze medal in the C-2 event at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich. Olry also won three medals at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships with one gold (C-2: 1969) and two bronzes (K-1 team: 1967, C-2 team: 1969). He partner in the C-2 boat was his brother Jean-Claude. ==References== * * Category:1946 births Category:Canoeists at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:French male canoeists Category:Living people Category:Olympic canoeists of France Category:Olympic bronze medalists for France Category:Olympic medalists in canoeing Category:Medalists at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships
title: Jean-Louis Olry
